contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox radio station | name = XHGTS-FM | image = [http://www.xhgts.com/images/logo_black.jpg XHGTS-FM Station Logo] | city = [[Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas]] | area = [[Nuevo Laredo|Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas]]<br>[[Laredo, Texas]] | branding = 107.3 ¡Música Internacional! | slogan = ¡Música Internacional! | airdate = 8-February-2012. | frequency = 107.3 ([[Megahertz|MHz]]) | format = [[Contemporary hit radio|International Contemporary]] | power = 23,000 [[watt]]s | erp = | haat = 100 meters | class = B | coordinates = {{Coord|27.5150703|-99.5596826|type:landmark_region:MX-TAM|display=inline,title}} | callsign_meaning = | former_callsigns = | owner = [[BMP Radio|BMP de Nuevo Laredo S.A. de C.V.]]<br>''(License and Transmitter owned by a Mexican company)'' | webcast = [http://www.globalpc.net/xhgts/xhgts-fm.asx XHGTS-FM Online] | website = [http://www.xhgts.com xhgts.com] | affiliations = }} '''XHGTS-FM 107.3''' (branded as Música Internacional) is an [[Pop Contemporary Hit Radio|International Contemporary]] Music format [[FM broadcasting|FM]] [[radio station]] that serves the [[Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas]], [[Mexico]] and [[Laredo, Texas]], [[USA]] border area. XHGTS mostly airs [[Spanish and English language]] [[International Pop Music|pop]] and [[Rock music|rock]] hits.<ref>[http://dgsrt.sct.gob.mx/index.php?id=448 SCT; infraestructura de estaciones de radio y televisión comprende]</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} <br clear=all> {{Nuevo Laredo Radio}} [[Category:Contemporary hit radio stations in Mexico]] [[Category:Radio stations in Nuevo Laredo]] [[Category:Radio stations in Laredo, Texas]] [[Category:Radio stations established in 2003]] {{Mexico-radio-station-stub}}
